newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends down on commercial selling.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends down on commercial selling.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures closed lower on commercial selling, traders said.
"There was good selling by commercials and inter market spreading with Kansas City," a trader said.
Active seedings of the spring wheat crop continued to weigh on the market, the traders said.
Wilson Trading, Peavey and Benson Quinn each sold roughly one million bushels of July and ADM Investor Serices bought one million bushels of September.
MGE spring wheat futures closed 4-1/4 to 6-1/4 cents lower, with July down five cents at $3.94 per bushel.
MGE barley futures closed unchanged, with July at $6.50 per cwt.
Wheat futures volume was estimated by MGE at 23.662 million bushels, above the 17.510 million traded Thursday.
